[vc_column_text]If you plan to apply for Canadian immigration or a temporary Canadian visa, you should contact a Regulated Canadian Immigration Consultant (RCIC) for assistance. These professionals possess the legal authority to offer immigration advice to individuals. They are certified by the College of Immigration and Citizenship (CICC) and receive their credentials after meeting specific academic credentials, completing a certification program, and passing an Entry-to-Practice (EPE) exam.

This guide will cover the top 12 reasons to hire a Regulated Canadian Immigration Consultant.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”padding-6-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” centered_text=”true” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][nectar_btn size=”large” button_style=”regular” button_color_2=”Accent-Color” icon_family=”default_arrow” text=”Connect with a Licensed RCIC” url=”https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/book-consultation/”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text]

1. Convenience

Hiring an RCIC is excellent because it is incredibly convenient. If you’re in a hurry to find a professional who can guide you on immigration-related matters, you need to Google “Regulated Canadian Immigration Consultant in Surrey, BC.” This allows you to find someone knowledgeable and reliable without spending too much time searching.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

2. Avoid Mistakes

You will generally need to include lots of information in any visa or immigration application you submit. However, your application could get rejected if you make a single mistake. Immigration, Refugees, and Citizenship Canada (IRCC) try to make the application process as simple as possible, but you may still be confused when filling out specific form fields.

In this situation, it is best to turn to an RCIC for assistance with your application. These professionals will help you fill out forms and tell you which documents to include. This approach will help you minimize mistakes in your application.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” bottom_padding=”5%” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”padding-6-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color=”#96001c” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”Start Your Case with a Licensed RCIC” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left|color:%23ffffff” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner column_padding=”padding-6-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”1px” column_border_color=”#707070″ column_border_style=”solid”][nectar_btn size=”large” button_style=”regular” button_color_2=”Accent-Color” icon_family=”none” text=”Quick Consultation” url=”https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/book-consultation/20min/”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text]

3. RCICs Understand the Canadian Visa System

The Canadian visa system can be tricky to navigate on your own. You must complete steps in a specific sequence, gather the proper documents, and fulfill special requirements depending on the visa or immigration program you are pursuing. Feeling lost over something that can impact your future can be easy. Seeking help from an RCIC is advantageous because they understand the Canadian visa system and how to navigate it.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

4. Saves You Time and Money

Making a mistake in your visa or immigration application can cost you time and money. This is because you won’t receive a refund for the application processing fees you paid if your application is rejected. You will also need to start the process again, which will delay things significantly. Hiring an RCIC is advantageous because they can help you get things right on your first try. Therefore, using their services could help you save time and money.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

5. Handle Refusal Cases

Being refused a visa can feel demotivating for many people. After being rejected, you might feel like giving up on trying for a Canadian visa. However, an RCIC can help you turn things around. These professionals can assess why your application was refused and help you create an optimized one that addresses the initial issue.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

6. Handle Complex Cases

People with complex backgrounds may feel reluctant to apply for Canadian visas because they believe they do not meet IRCC’s exact requirements. You shouldn’t be discouraged if you fall into this category. A qualified RCIC can examine your background, no matter how complicated. They can guide you in completing your visa application and boost your odds of being approved.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

7. Handle Inadmissibility Cases

IRCC generally considers people with criminal backgrounds and those with certain medical conditions to be inadmissible to Canada. Therefore, they are unlikely to issue visas to such individuals.

The great news is that you may be able to overcome this obstacle with the help of an RCIC. These immigration professionals can assess the conditions surrounding your inadmissibility and advise on how to proceed.

For example, the RCIC may help you apply for a waiver or a pardon on a past criminal charge. Doing this may make you admissible to Canada again.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” bottom_padding=”5%” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”padding-6-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color=”#96001c” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”Hire an Experienced RCIC” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left|color:%23ffffff” use_theme_fonts=”yes”][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner column_padding=”padding-6-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/2″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”1px” column_border_color=”#707070″ column_border_style=”solid”][nectar_btn size=”large” button_style=”regular” button_color_2=”Accent-Color” icon_family=”none” text=”Speak with an expert” url=”https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/contact-us/”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text]

8. They Can Help You Find Work in Canada

Many foreigners wish to work in Canada and eventually settle in the country. However, getting a Canadian job from outside the country can be challenging.

Hiring an RCIC could be advantageous because they typically maintain an extensive network of Canadian business owners and hiring managers. Therefore, they can help match you with Canadian employers seeking skilled foreign workers.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

9. They Will Protect Your Personal Information

Canadian visa and immigration applications contain lots of personal information. Someone could use this information against you if it falls into the wrong hands. You can trust RCIC to protect your personal information because they took an oath to do this when they received their certification. For this reason, you won’t need to worry about the information you give an RCIC being misused.

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

10. They Will Create a Personalized Strategy for Maximized Success

Canada offers dozens of immigration programs, and knowing which suits you isn’t always easy. An RCIC can assess your background and recommend the program that offers you the most excellent chance of succeeding. They can also create an optimized application that capitalizes on your background and qualifications.

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

11. They Will Stand Up For You

RCICs understand immigration law thoroughly. This means they can recognize if an immigration official is treating you unfairly and then stand up for you. Such professionals maintain close communication with immigration officials, so they will always know when an official isn’t performing their duties as they should be.

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

12. Enable You to Follow Ethical Code of Conduct

IRCC requires all immigration applicants to follow an ethical code of conduct to meet requirements. Hiring an RCIC is advantageous because they can ensure you remain aware of the rules and regulations to follow until your status is approved.
